snippet: Opponents dismissed the nearly two dozen bills as “feel-good legislation” that would accomplish little, and Gov. Chris Christie could veto any that pass.
abstract: New Jersey Legislature takes up collection of nearly two dozen bills that would tighten gun controls, prompting angry protests from gun rights advocates; New Jersey, which already has some of strictest gun-control laws in nation, is joining other states in moving quickly to enact greater restrictions in wake of Newtown, Conn, shooting.
lead_paragraph: Opponents dismissed the nearly two dozen bills as “feel-good legislation” that would accomplish little, and Gov. Chris Christie could veto any that pass.

headline.seo: New Jersey Assembly Committee Approves Tightening Gun Laws
headline.main: New Jersey Assembly Panel Backs Tougher Gun Laws
headline.print_headline: New Jersey Assembly Panel Backs Tougher Gun Laws
